docs.lead_paragraph: As part of her television blitz tonight on the day after her romp in West Virginia, Senator Hillary Clinton persisted in her desire to campaign through the early June primaries.
docs.abstract: In interviews, Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton used her West Virginia win to continue making the case for her candidacy.
docs.snippet: In interviews, Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton used her West Virginia win to continue making the case for her candidacy.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following is a transcript of John Edwards’s speech in Grand Rapids, Mich., endorsing Senator Barack Obama for president, as provided by CQ Transcriptions.

docs.lead_paragraph: New York’s public and private hospitals stand to lose more than $1 billion in funds for the training of doctors because of changes to Medicaid backed by the Bush administration, an analysis says.

headline.main: Cuts in Medicaid May Mean Billion-Dollar Loss to New York for Training Doctors
headline.print_headline: Cuts in Medicaid May Mean Billion-Dollar Loss to New York for Training Doctors

docs.snippet: New York’s public and private hospitals stand to lose more than $1 billion in funds for the training of doctors because of changes to Medicaid backed by the Bush administration, an analysis says.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senate and House Democrats said that they had reached a tentative agreement on a budget blueprint that sets spending levels somewhat higher than President Bush had requested.

headline.main: Budget Deal in Congress Tops Request From Bush
headline.print_headline: Budget Deal In Congress Tops Request From Bush

docs.snippet: Senate and House Democrats said that they had reached a tentative agreement on a budget blueprint that sets spending levels somewhat higher than President Bush had requested.

docs.lead_paragraph: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.
docs.abstract: In this lesson, students discuss the May 12, 2008, earthquake in Western China. They conduct research to learn more about earthquakes and disaster relief to countries such as China and plan a community project to provide aid to the earthquake's victims.

byline.original: By CATHERINE HUTCHINGS and BRIDGET ANDERSON

docs.lead_paragraph: Would Hillary Rodham Clinton drop her bid in exchange for Barack Obama’s embrace of universal health care?

headline.seo: Katharine Q. Seelye - On Line - The New York Times - Politics - Election 2008

docs.snippet: Would Hillary Rodham Clinton drop her bid in exchange for Barack Obama’s embrace of universal health care?

docs.lead_paragraph: An article on May 4 about the growing difficulty that people with health insurance have affording medical care misstated the co-payment that one patient, Sage Holben, must pay at each visit to her doctor. After checking her records, Ms. Holben says her co-payment is $22, not the $25 she originally stated.

docs.lead_paragraph: Leaders of Ewing, in the bluegrass country of northeast Kentucky, are facing a problem any mayor would envy.
